title: Features
content:
“Sound game training” app is an app for practicing sound games.
You can check the notes by playing back the video, and you can also pseudo-play by touching on the video.
Adding a Playback Video There are four ways to add videos to be played in the app.
Camera roll The camera roll is the place where videos are saved when you take a video on your device. You can view it from the Photos app.
Here’s how you can add them in this app.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “Camera Roll” from the list of alternatives Select the video you want to add Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
iCloud Drive iCloud Drive is an online storage service provided by Apple. You can view it from the Files app.
Here’s how you can add them in this app.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “iCloud Drive” from the list of alternatives Select the video you want to add Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Transfer from PC It’s a way to transfer videos from the Music (formerly iTunes) app on your PC to your device’s app storage.
“Use iTunes to share files between your computer and your iOS or iPadOS device” page will tell you how to transfer it to the app, please refer here.
Here’s how you can add them in this app.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “Within the app” from the list of alternatives Select the video you want to add Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Play YouTube video YouTube is a video sharing service from Google. Videos of sound games uploaded by others exist.
Here’s how you can add them in this app.
 Open the “Video List” screen Click on the “Add Video” button at the bottom right of the screen Select “YouTube” from the list of alternatives Open the video page you want to add from the YouTube site Click the “Add video” button at the bottom right of the video page Enter your registration information and click the “Add” button  After this step, you can return to the “Video List” screen and your added videos will be in the list.
Since the app does not download YouTube videos, a traffic volume is generated every time a video is played on this app.
 Pseudo-play You won’t be paused by tapping on the playing video screen.
So you can play a pseudo sound game.
There are many other features that make it easier to practice.
 Adjust the video playback speed
You can adjust the playback speed in the range of 0.25-2.00x speed Adjust the start/end position of video playback
You can set the start and end of the play range to focus on the difficult parts of the game Zoom in/out and adjust the position of the video
Scaling and positioning can be done to make the video fit the device resolution Flipping the video screen
The video screen can be flipped left to right Support for both portrait and landscape video
You can fix your device orientation in portrait or landscape mode Shortcut button to rewind/fast-forward for a few seconds during playback
The shortcut button is set up so that you can easily manipulate the time without having to pause and operate the seek bar  Bookmark the playback position  There is a function to register the start/end position of video playback as a bookmark.
By setting the start/end position of playback for each number, you can quickly switch the playback position for the part you want to practice.
Supports a variety of game touchlines  The touchline of the sound game is often different for each device. The touchline position of the desired video and the device may be different.
To address this issue, the app supports a guide display to help you align the touchline on your device.
Supported games are listed below.
 Deemo VOEZ Arcaea Dynamix BanG Dream! Project Sekai Colorful Stage! feat. Hatsune Miku THE IDOLM@STER MILLION LIVE! Theater Days THE IDOLM@STER CINDERELLA GIRLS STARLIGHT STAGE THE IDOLM@STER SideM GROWING STARS Love Live! School idol festival HYPNOSISMIC -A.R.B- Ensemble Stars!! Music Re:Stage! Prism Step D4DJ Groovy Mix Tokyo 7th Sisters Uta Macross Girlfriend (note) Touhou Danmaku Kagura  Depending on the device where you filmed the play video, you may not be able to adjust to the touch position.

title: FAQ
content:
Video    Q. Do you think I can practice music games with an app that just plays videos?   You can do the following things to improve your practice.
‚óè No pausing by tapping the screen during playback
‚óè You can set the playback range
‚óè You can adjust the playback speed
‚óè Video expansion, contraction and movement is possible
Just tapping the screen while playing the part you're weak in is good enough practice üí™
So start practicing today ‚ô™~        Q. Can I orient it vertically?   "Video Selection" You can change the orientation by tapping the "Device is rotating" icon in the bottom left corner of the screen.
Tap again to return to landscape orientation.        Q. Is it possible to make a touch sound?   You can set up the touch sound from "Settings  Settings on Video  Sound" in the app.
There are various types of touch sounds available, so you can choose the one you like best ‚ô™~        Q. Is it possible to show the touch points?   You can set the display settings for touch from "Settings  Settings on Video  Point" in the app.
You can also set the color and display size, so you can adjust it to your liking ‚ô™~        Q. Can I adjust the volume of the touch sound?   You cannot do this in the app. Please adjust the volume on your device.        Q. The home bar gets in the way during pseudo-play, making it difficult to play. Is there a home bar setting?   You can ignore the first home bar operation from "Settings  Video  Home Bar" in the app.        Q. I'm having trouble with the tap position and pause button being in the same place in some play videos. Can you fix this problem?   You can change the pause button to a long tap.
On the "Folder List" screen, you can select "Edit  Settings on Video  Pause button" to change to long tap.        Q. Where can I set up the app's touchline display?   On the "Folder List" screen, you can set it up by going to "Edit  Select Folder  App Type".        Q. Can you fix the sound shift?   There is no way to solve this problem within the app.
I do hope to respond to this someday, though.        Q. Is there a function to fast forward/rewind for a few seconds?   You can set it from the "Folder Settings  Fast forward/rewind button" button at the bottom left of the folder/video list screen.
You can also adjust the position of the display on the video screen and the number of seconds ‚ô™~        Q. Can I reposition or hide the rewind/fast forward button?   You can change or hide the position.
You can set it from the "Folder Settings  Fast forward/rewind button" button at the bottom left of the folder/video list screen.        Q. The resolution of YouTube videos is low. Is it possible for me to change it?   You can choose from 240p/360p/720p. The default setting is 360p.
You can configure the settings from "Common Settings  Video traffic" at the bottom left of the video list screen.       Q. When will the "xxx" app type be added?   It is difficult to support the recent iOS devices due to the increase in the number of different ratios. In addition, there are more and more apps that allow you to adjust the touchline position on the sound game app side, so it is not worth it.
This is why the frequency of updating the app types is low. However, that doesn't mean we don't want to increase the frequency.     Requests/bugs    Q. Where do I make my request?   Please send us your request from "Contact" in the app. We can't accept all requests, but we will consider them.
I'm also open to reviews on the AppStore. However, it is difficult to communicate with them, so we may not be able to understand their intentions.        Q. Where do I report bugs?   Please send us your request from "Contact" in the app.
Since it is difficult to communicate with AppStore reviews, it may not be possible to reproduce them and there may be a delay in response.        Q. YouTube videos are no longer playing in the app. Is this a bug?   It's most likely a bug. Please contact us from "Contact" in the app, including the URL of the video that is not playing.       Q. Videos from my camera roll are no longer playing in the app. Is this a bug?   Deleting a video from the camera roll will stop it from playing.
If you choose to save photos to iCloud, they will not be playable at a later date. Please register the video uploaded to iCloud to the application.
If you have videos in your camera roll but they do not play, try restarting the app/device to see if that solves the problem.     Other    Q. Can't I get rid of ads through in-app purchases?   I have no plans to sell ad removal items.        Q. Do you accept Donate?   I accept from the donation link in the menu on the upper left.
The donations received will be used as food for living.       Q. Will you be distributing the Android app?   Distribution started on 08/06/2022.
For the Android version, please refer to the following website.
https://hyoromo.github.io/sound-game-training-android/
